column1: Which condition is caused by genetic abnormalities during the process of gastrulation:
column8:
Correct: B. Sirenomelia
Sirenomelia (mermaid syndrome) results from severe disturbances of mesoderm formation during gastrulation, affecting caudal development.

Correct: C. 9+2 arranged parallel microtubules
The axoneme of motile cilia and flagella has the classic 9 peripheral doublets + 2 central microtubules arrangement.

column1: The spermiation is a process of releasing the spermatozoa from:
column8:
Correct: D. Sertoli cells
Spermiation is the release of mature spermatozoa from the apical surface of Sertoli cells into the lumen of seminiferous tubules.

column1: Which layer of the trophoblast secretes hydrolytic enzymes to invade the endometrium:
column8:
Correct: C. Syncytiotrophoblast
The syncytiotrophoblast invades the endometrium by secreting proteolytic (hydrolytic) enzymes.

column1: Match the organ on the left to the corresponding process that occurs in it:
column2:
Testis ⇒ spermatogenesis
Epididymis ⇒ maturing
Ductus deferens ⇒ transport of mature sperm cells
column3:
Testis ⇒ hormone secretion only
Epididymis ⇒ fertilization
Ductus deferens ⇒ storage
column5:
Testis ⇒ transport
Epididymis ⇒ hormone secretion
Ductus deferens ⇒ fertilization
column8:
Correct: A
  • Testis: spermatogenesis
  • Epididymis: sperm maturation
  • Ductus deferens: transport of mature sperm

column1: The Leydig cells are found in:
column8:
Correct: B. Interstitial tissue between seminiferous tubules
Leydig cells are endocrine cells producing testosterone, located in the interstitial space.

column1: The process of transformation of spermatogonia in mature spermatozoa is called:
column8:
Correct: D. Spermatogenesis
Spermatogenesis includes all stages from spermatogonia to mature spermatozoa.

column1: Match the terms on the left with the appropriate definitions from the drop list:
column8:
Correct: A. Plasma cell ⇒ antibody production
Plasma cells are terminally differentiated B lymphocytes specialized in immunoglobulin secretion.

column4: Golgi phase, acrosome phase and maturation phase
column8:
Correct: C
Spermiogenesis (part of spermatogenesis) includes the Golgi, acrosome, and maturation phases.

Correct: C. Distal centriole
The distal centriole gives rise to the axoneme of the flagellum.

column1: An average quantity of sperm (ejaculate) is:
column6: None of the answers is correct
column8:
Correct: E
Normal ejaculate volume is up to 5 ml, therefore none of the listed ranges are correct.

column1: The blood vessels of which structure form the blood vessels of the umbilical cord?
column8:
Correct: B. Allantois
The umbilical vessels develop from the allantoic vessels.

column1: How many veins does the umbilical cord contain?
column8:
Correct: C. One
The umbilical cord contains two arteries and one vein.

column1: Which layer does NOT participate in the formation of chorion?
column8:
Correct: D. Mesoderm
The chorion is formed by trophoblast layers + extraembryonic mesoderm, not intraembryonic mesoderm.

column1: Approx. on which day does the heart begin to beat?
column8:
Correct: C. Day 22
The primitive heart tube begins rhythmic contractions around day 22.

column1: How many layers does the trophoblast contain at the time of implantation?
column8:
Correct: B. Two
The trophoblast differentiates into cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast.

Correct: C. The basal area of epithelial cells
Hemidesmosomes anchor epithelial cells to the basal lamina.

column1: Which are the different types of glandular epithelium:
column8:
Correct: C. Endocrine and exocrine
Glandular epithelia are classified by presence or absence of ducts.

column4: Basophils and mast cells (in the liver)
column8:
Correct: C
Heparin is produced by basophils and mast cells, particularly abundant in liver and connective tissue.
